abstract.t: This document specifies the Semantic Inference Routing Protocol (SIRP), a framework for content-level classification and semantic routing in AI inference systems. By analyzing the content of inference requests--rather than relying solely on client-supplied metadata--SIRP enables routing decisions that are more robust, consistent, and extensible. SIRP also defines optional value-added routing (VAR) extensions for cost optimization, urgency prioritization, domain specialization, and privacy-aware handling.
